column7: WiseTech's scope 1 emissions in 2023 were 234 tCO2e.
WiseTech's scope 2 emissions in 2023 were 3,146 tCO2e.
WiseTech's scope 3 emissions in 2023 were 4,585 tCO2e.
WiseTech's emissions intensity in 2023 was 4.14 tCO2e per million AUD revenue.

column13: WiseTech offsets its FY23 Scope 1 and 2 emissions using a mixed portfolio of offsets from cool fire projects conducted at Arnhem Land in Australia's Northern Territory and wind power projects in southern India and the United States. These offsets align with the Emissions Reduction Fund, Clean Development Mechanism and Verified Carbon standards.
column20: Cool fire project, wind power project, Emissions Reduction Fund

Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column13: WiseTech's insights from its waste audit were used to bring in an additional recycling service, modify bin locations, and install signage to improve waste separation and reduce waste going to landfills. The insights will also be used to design an internal communication campaign to build team members' understanding of waste disposal and recycling.
column20: Recycling service, waste audit, waste separation

column13: WiseTech undertook a waste audit better to understand the waste footprint of its Sydney headquarters. The audit provided insights into the quantity and types of rubbish typically produced in a day by team members in WiseTech's office floor and kitchen bins.

WiseTech recycled almost 6,000kgs of e-waste from its Melbourne, Sydney and York offices. It included laptops, PCs, monitors and servers. An additional 1,224 kgs of equipment was refurbished for reuse.
